question: Which among the following was the most important reason of objection to Simon Commission by Indian nationalists?
option1: There was No Indian member in Simon Commission
option2: Inexperienced people were sent to look into the state of Indian constitutional affairs
answer: There was No Indian member in Simon Commission
explanation: The Government of India Act 1919 declared that a royal commission will be set up after ten years to report about the credibility of the Act. But the Indian Statutory Commission was set up in 1927 even before the schedule. There were seven members in the commission. Sir John Simon was the chairman of the commission. Indian nationalists did not accept the commission as there was no Indian member. It was termed as All White Commission. The commission was greeted with Hartal and "Simon Go Back" Slogan when they reached in Bombay on 3rd February 1928. On the basis of the report of the commission published in 1930, the Government of India Act 1935 was drafted
